messages.title: The choice at this election is clear.
messages.content: A choice of working only for the few at the top, or a Labour plan to improve life for the many in Worcester.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Free childcare to help parents get back to work
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will extend free childcare for 3 & 4-year-olds to 25 hours to support working parents.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A better future for the NHS under Labour
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs and guarantee a GP appointment within 48 hours.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An economy that works for all, not just those at the top
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will raise the minimum wage to over £8 by October 2019, ban exploitative zero-hour contracts, cut business rates for small firms and freeze gas and electricity bills until 2017.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Tackle immigration in a fair way to ease our border controls and reassure residents
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour promises to recruit 1,000 more border staff, introduce fair rules, make it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers and stop migrant benefits for the first two years.

issues.economy: Labour will raise the minimum wage to over £8 by October 2019, ban exploitative zero-hour contracts, cut business rates for small firms and freeze gas and electricity bills until 2017.
issues.education: Labour will extend free childcare for 3 & 4-year-olds to 25 hours to support working parents.
issues.health: Labour will recruit 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs and guarantee a GP appointment within 48 hours.
issues.immigration: Labour promises to recruit 1,000 more border staff, introduce fair rules, make it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers and stop migrant benefits for the first two years.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am very proud to call Worcester my home and believe our city deserves better than the cost of living crisis and failing public services we are getting from the current government.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured funding for the dualling of the Southern Link road.
Campaigned to protect the NHS in Worcester and across the country.
Campaigned against the badger cull in Worcestershire and nationally.

politicalExperience.role: Fighting for Worcester's under-threat youth service

quotes.text: At the next election, Worcester can have a local MP who fights for our city and campaigns on the issues that matter.

leaflet.additionalNotes: This leaflet presents information about Joy Squires, the Labour candidate for Worcester in the forthcoming election, highlighting her key policies, local campaigning efforts, and commitment to the community she aims to serve as MP.
